review_blob: Amber wheat ale colour. Smells just like Apricots. Nice flavour with fruit and wheat combining nicely. More on the sweet side. Many guests really enjoy this beer &#
Black beer with a nice creamy foam head. Smells of dark roasted coffe, malts and a hint of cacao.Roasted flavor with a balanced hop bite. Very nice, i wish it was a little higher ABV.

Slightly orange cloudy colour. Nice big fluffly pillow head. The carbonation on this beer is excellent with beautiful floral and fruit notes. Super crisp and easy to drink. Really impressed with this one.

Cloudy very light coloured beer. Smells like lemons, limes, and of course peach. Very sour taste with lots of carbonation. Be prepared for sour!! I thought it would be crisp but this reminds me of those super sour peach candies I had years ago. I think it would go nice with an oily food.

With a name like "Hoppleganger" you would think this would be serious IBUs. Its not that hoppy at all. Fresh tasting with the pine smell of the various hops. The taste doesnt give you the strong bite that a Stone IPA would give you. It seems a little watered down. I like the Seattles PIKE Ipa much better.
Amber colour with a nice cramy head. Easy to drink with malts and light hops. Very clean and smooth beer.
Had this after trying the ABT 12. It should have been the other way around. It is a easier to drink version of the 12.
Good light faomy/fluffy head with a very dark colour. NIce roasted malt / yeast smell. Dark fruits with a delicate carbonation and well hidden alcohol. Great Stuff.
Very dark brown/black pour with a large foamy head. Smells of dark chocolate and licorice. Nice roasted malt taste with a hint of licorice. Good Beer.

Ports dark with a small head. The fluids moves around in a jello like fashion. Very thick beer like a syrup. Tastes like sweet dark fruit and I enjoyed the first 1/2 of the beer. I found when the beer warmed up a little more I was having trouble with the last sips. I think it was just too thick and sweet for me. I prefer the Rochefort by a mile.
UPDATED: SEP 8, 2009
Nice amber color. Floral hop smell. This is my 3rd time trying Orval and each time depending on the mood I am in I either like it or could go with out it. Its funky, hoppy, bitter and a unique beer.
Pours murky golden with a cream foam head. Yeast smell with light fruit notes. Spicy taste with well hidden alcohol , good carbonation. Very nice.
This is my first barley wine. Pors dark with zero head. Sweet with spicy taste and as another person said a metallic taste. It may be the style but I didnt enjoy this one so much.

I was really excited to try this beer and mabye a got a bunk bottle. It poured nice with a golden color and a nice head. The smell however was like a barn and really unpleasant. The taste was better than the smell but I really could not enjoy the beer having the smell hit me each time I drank more.
Red/pink pour with loads of carbonation. Sweet and tastes of sour cherries. I prefer the taste of the framboise and will be sticking with that one over the cherry.
Pours a framboise red with loads of carbonation. Keep in mind there is a cap and a cork to open it. Taste is sweet and of berries. A fun drink that even non-beer lovers will probably enjoy.

Golden pour with a piny hoppy smell. Taste is well balanced and not to harsh in any area. Very drinkable and quite enjoyable. i may give some more IPAs a chance now as they are usually not my favorite.
Fresh Tangerine smell with a murky burnt orange colour. Nice for a change of pace but not somthing i would drink very often.

I can actually find this beer in Vancouver, Canada. Firefly and brewery creek have it. Sweet yeast smell that is delicate and enticing. The beer is dark and rich looking with a light head. The taste is complex showing dark fruit. Really enjoyable and even better its accessable.

A: Deep amber color. Little head.
S: Dark Fruit and malts. 
T: Sweet malts with a crisp finish. 
M: Medium body 
D: Really enjoyed this one. My favorite from Dogfish head as I am not a bi fan of hoppy beer.

A: Coppor colour, medium head
S: Honey, Grape, Syrup
T: French toast with grape jam.
M: Maple Syrup with an alcohol fiinish
D: Not a session beer. I enjoyed it but prefer the raison detra for dogfish head.
beer_name: Dogfish Head Midas Touch Golden Elixir

review_blob: Massive head that lingers around. Nice malty sweetness with a dry finish. Very drinkable and highly enjoyable.
First time it was available at the BCL in Vancouver BC. Enjoyed it on a hot day with some spicy BBQ. Lots of head and carbonation. Yeast balanced with hops. Very crisp with a dry finish. Great beer.

Bought at Liqor Depot in Vernon BC. I have not seen this beer for sale anywhere else in BC. Insane head!! Even more than Duvel. The color was murky gold with some sediment at the bottom. Taste was almost hard to swallow until the carbonation calmed down. Then it became very nice with lemon, bananna, bread and yeast. Enjoyable.

i love this beer. This was the beer that gave me interest in beer. It hold a special place in my heart. It pours dark amber with a beautiful head. Yeast, bread and light flavours go down easy. Alcohol is well hidden. Its a classic beer that i can get on a consistent basis.

Tried this at Gollem bar in Amsterdam as the 12 was all sold out. Complex flavor showing yeast, malt, caramel and more. I enjoyed it but not as much as the 12. Dont get me wrong its still an amazing beer.

This is the beer that made me realize I am not a fan of reeeeally hoppy beer. Smells like a forrest with sap ooozing down trees. I tve Rogue use twice as much ingredients and if you like a hoppy beer then give this a try. Mabye my palate will change down the road.
Massive head just like the picture shows. What makes this beer for me is the carbonation. Its a champagne beer. I prefer it nice and cold. Taste is a little peppery, with a balanced clean finish.

Enjoyed this beer at Gollem pub in Amsterdam. A must visit for any beer lover. Cost 13 euros. Pours very dark with a little head. So many flavours I cannot pick them out individually. Its very complex. It may be the hype but I really enjoyed this beer felt lucky to have tried it. When i came back to the bar a couple weeks later it was all sold out.
You can certainly taste the dry hopping. It finishes nice and crisp. I am not a huge fan of super hoppy beers and I find this one tolerable. It smells of pine and sap.
